article_title: Idaho health care debate may have turned a corner
article_text:
For many lawmakers, inaction on coverage for poor no longer an option

PCAP, the state alternative to Medicaid expansion, proved its shortcomings

An Idaho alternative: Not PCAP, but not traditional expansion, either

article_metadata.news-keywords: Gov., governor, butch, otter, Medicaid, medicare, health, insurance, exchange, Obamacare, Affordable, Care, Act, ID, Iowa, Jenny, Steinke, dentzer, Legislature, Statehouse
article_metadata.description: Idaho’s state-sponsored plan for getting poorer residents to the doctor took a likely fatal blow last week, but it might have given its life for the greater good. One consensus now dictates that lawmakers must act and another is emerging on what lawmakers need to do: Not Otter’s primary care bill, but not Medicaid expansion, either.
article_metadata.title: Idaho health care debate may have turned a corner | Idaho Statesman
